term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - optical-beam error in spectrochemical analysis
term.title: optical-beam error

item.text: For wavelength-scanning spectrometers, an error may be introduced if the image position on the photodetector changes. Reflection of the incident radiation, e.g. between the cell walls, is another source of error and results in a measured absorbance slightly higher than the true absorbance. These errors are collectively termed optical-beam errors.
